raw_text:
Juninho demand for O'Neill talks
 
 Juninho's agent has confirmed that the player is hoping for talks with Martin O'Neill as the Brazilian midfielder comes closer to departing Celtic.
 
 Brian Hassell says no official approach has been received from Manchester City but that the English club had been earmarked as a possible destination. But it was being stressed to BBC Sport that Juninho would prefer to remain with the Scottish champions. Juninho wants assurances that he will return to O'Neill's first-team plans. He has become frustrated with his lack of first-team action since his move from Middlesbrough in the summer. Hassel says Juninho, who has just bought a new home, would "desperately like to stay at Celtic" but will seek a move if it is made clear that he is not wanted.
 
 The agent also stressed that nothing should be read into the 30-year-old's father being in Scotland and talk of a move back to Botafogo in Brazil. Juninho's father was simply in the country to see his son and grandchildren. "I know there is interest from a Brazilian club, but I know Juninho doesn't want to go there," said Hassel. "He wants to stay in Britain. In fact, he wants to stay at Celtic." Hassall made it clear that a move to Manchester City, who are badly in need of a midfield play-maker, was more of a possibility than Botafogo, or Mexican outfit Red Sharks Veracruz, who also expressed an interest. "It was a thought at one stage," he said. "If you are not going to get a game under one manager, you look for another whose style of play suits you. "He is a fan of Kevin Keegan's style of play. It would not be a bad move for him." Juninho had earlier told the Daily Record: "The manager has had a lot of chances to put me in his team but it hasn't happened. "If that is the case then this is the opportunity for me to go. That would be good for the club and good for me. "If I have no part in his plans, there is no point in remaining here waiting for a chance that never comes." The attacking midfielder also claims he has not had the backing of boss Martin O'Neill since his move to Celtic Park. "I can't understand why I am in this situation," he continued. "When a manager brings a new player to the club, he gives that player support."
llama3.2:1b: Juninho's agent confirms talks with Martin O'Neill are on, but Juninho wants assurances that he will remain with the Scottish champions.
His father was visiting and is not interested in a move back to Brazil or Mexican outfit Red Sharks Veracruz.
A potential transfer to Manchester City has been ruled out due to the club's needs for midfield play.
llama3.2:3b: Juninho's agent says the Brazilian midfielder wants to stay with Celtic but is willing to consider Manchester City if his playing time under Martin O'Neill is not guaranteed.
Juninho has become frustrated with limited first-team action since joining in the summer and wants assurances from O'Neill of regular playing time.

His father being in Scotland for a visit has been misinterpreted as interest from Botafogo, with Juninho's agent denying this, saying his client prefers to stay in Britain and play under O'Neill's style of play.
gemma2:2b: Juninho's agent says he hopes to speak with Martin O'Neill about his future at Celtic.
Juninho desires assurances of first-team playing time and would prefer to stay with the Scottish club if he receives that assurance.
Manchester City is a potential destination for Juninho, although he has expressed interest in staying at Celtic.
He cites lack of playing opportunities under O'Neill as motivation for seeking a move.
qwen2.5:0.5b: A Portuguese player named Juninho is worried about leaving Celtic and wants to stay with the Scottish champions Manchester City, despite his father being there in Scotland.
He claims he's not interested in moving to Brazil and wants to play for Manchester City because his new manager, Kevin Keegan, plays well.
Juninho says he has enough experience playing in a different style of football now, but he still misses Celtic's home environment.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Juninho's agent confirms that Brazilian midfielder Juninho is hoping for talks with former Scotland manager Martin O'Neill following his departure from Celtic.
Hassell states Juninho wants assurances of first-team return and prefers to remain at Celtic.
Hassel also mentions interest in Manchester City, Botafogo, Red Sharks Veracruz, but expresses Botafogo as more likely due to Juninho's preference for keeping fit after a new home purchase.
qwen2.5:3b: Juninho's agent confirms the player is seeking talks with Martin O'Neill regarding possible moves away from Celtic.
While no official approach has been received from Manchester City, Juninho prefers to remain at Celtic where he wants assurances of inclusion in first-team plans.
His father's visit to Scotland was merely for personal reasons and not related to a potential move back to Brazil or any other club.
Hassell believes Manchester City is more likely to offer a position than Botafogo or Veracruz, citing Juninho’s preference for British football.
Juninho has expressed frustration over limited playing time under O'Neill since joining Celtic in the summer and believes he should be considered for first-team action by the manager.
opencoder:1.5b:
Juninho's demand for O'Neill talks between a Brazilian and an English midfielder comes with a couple of key elements:

1.

A move from Middlesbrough: Brian Hassell, who was not part of the club's recruitment agreement with the summer move away from Celtic, made it clear that he would be moved back to Celtic if it were confirmed they wanted a match.
An argument about his father's home country: Juninho's dad, an 30-year-old Irish, was in Scotland when he bought his new home and it was this visit that frustrated him more than anything else.
The club's manager, Martin O'Neill, was known for his professionalism and willingness to assist with any issues related to the recruitment process.
The interaction between Juninho and O'Neill highlights how their relationship has been growing and has seen them continue to expand their expectations about each other's moves, feelings, and actions.
The coach's reassurance about the possibility of a move back to Celtic from the summer break was evident in the conversation.

deepseek-r1:1.5b: Juninho's agent confirmed plans for talks with Martin O'Neill at Celtic, indicating potential between Juninho and O'Neill.
Brian Hassell emphasized no official approach from Manchester City but noted that the English club was seen as a possible destination.
The agent stressed that Juninho wants assurance he'll return to O'Neill's team after his move from Middlesbrough.
Juninho is frustrated about not being on the field since leaving Celtic Park, lacking support from O'Neill.
The agent mentioned the father of Juninho in Scotland, possibly just visiting grandchildren, and caution against potential moves to Botafogo or Mexican teams like Red Sharks Veracruz.
Juninho wants an opportunity if it works, emphasizing the club's need for a midfield player.
tinyllama:1.1b: According to a report by BBC Sport, Scottish midfielder Juninho has reportedly become frustrated with his lack of first-team action and is desperate for assurance that he will return to manager Martin O'Neill's plans.
His father was in Scotland to see his son and grandchildren, but Juninho's agent has confirmed that the Brazilian midfielder's aim is to remain at Scottish champions Celtic.
The 30-year-old claims he hasn't had support from manager O'Neill since joining the club, which he says has made his situation "unbearable."
Despite this, Juninho has reportedly expressed a willingness to stay at the club if it is clear that he will return to the squad.
The report also suggests that Manchester City and Botafogo are both interested in Juninho's services but have not been in contact with Celtic about his future yet.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Summary: Celtic midfielder Juninho has expressed interest in a transfer to Manchester City or Botafogo but wants reassurances from his agent before making a decision.
His father also visited Scotland to see him and his grandchildren.
Brian Hassell, the agent, emphasized that Juninho prefers returning to O'Neill's first-team plans if offered an opportunity.
He has become frustrated with his lack of first-team action since his move from Middlesbrough in the summer and is seeking assurances that he will return to O'Neill’s midfield plan.
Juninho has not had a chance to play for Celtic since joining on a free transfer.

Brian Hassell stated that Manchester City was being earmarked as a possible destination but that Juninho would prefer to remain at Celtic and return to O'Neill's first-team plans.
The agent also mentioned that there is interest from Brazilian clubs, but Juninho wants to stay in Britain and hopes to find a club whose style of play suits him.
Juninho has not had any involvement with manager Martin O'Neill since his move to Celtic Park.

His agent has confirmed that the player is hoping for talks with O'Neill.
Manchester City are a possible destination but his preferred option is to remain at Celtic.
hermes3:3b: Juninho wants talks with Celtic manager O'Neill for guaranteed first-team play after growing frustrated with limited action since summer transfer from Middlesbrough.

Though no official approach has been made by Manchester City, Juninho wants assurances that he will return to O'Neill's first-team plans.
His preference is to remain at Celtic, but he may seek a move if it's clear he's not wanted.

While there are interests from Brazilian clubs like Botafogo and Mexican team Red Sharks Veracruz, Juninho's agent said Manchester City is more of a possibility due to their need for a midfield playmaker.

While Manchester City has been considered a possible destination, Juninho prefers to stay at Celtic if assured of a role in the team.
His agent dismissed speculation about a move to Brazil, emphasizing that Juninho wants to remain in Britain.
Although Manchester City, in need of a playmaker, is a potential option, Juninho is disappointed by O'Neill's lack of support and is open to leaving if he is not in the manager's plans.
stablelm2:1.6b: Juninho's agent is seeking talks with Martin O'Neill for reassurance after the Brazilian midfielder's approach towards leaving Celtic increases.
Despite interest from Manchester City and Botafogo, Juninho wants to remain at Celtic and would seek a move if it's clear he isn't wanted.
He'd prefer a move back to Britain rather than Brazil.
There is no indication of his father moving between Scotland and Brazil.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Juninho, the 30-year-old Brazilian midfielder for Celtic, is considering talks with Manchester City's manager, Martin O'Neill.

His agent, Brian Hassell, confirmed that while there has been no official approach from Manchester City, they were previously seen as a potential destination due to the player's desire for more playing time and preference to stay in Britain rather than return to Brazil or Mexico.
Juninho, who recently purchased a new home, is frustrated with his limited first-team opportunities since joining Celtic from Middlesbrough.

He has expressed dissatisfaction with O'Neill's management and lack of support, stating that if he sees no chance to be part of the team under O'Neill, a move might be necessary for his career development and the club's benefit.
